alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued August 12 at 2:23PM MST until August 12 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM MST FOR PINAL COUNTY... At 222 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from Magma to 12 miles west of Kearny, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than one quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 87 between mile markers 128 and 140. AZ Route 79 between mile markers 129 and 138. Locations impacted include... Florence, Coolidge, Blackwater, Magma, San Tan Valley, Randolph, Coolidge Airport and Valley Farms. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, then pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
